intro: Pleurogyne spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed pleurogyne, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or heathland environments. Pleurogyne spathulata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of conditions.
